title: Understanding Credit Card Statement Charges
content:
Help customers understand their credit card statement:

1. Walk through statement sections: Previous Balance, Payments, New Charges, Interest, Fees.
2. Explain different charge types:
   - Purchase transactions (merchant name, date, amount)
   - Cash advances (higher interest rate, immediate interest charges)
   - Balance transfers (promotional rates may apply)
   - Fees (annual, late payment, over-limit, foreign transaction)
3. Clarify interest calculation: Daily periodic rate x average daily balance.
4. Explain minimum payment calculation (typically 2-3% of balance or $25 minimum).
5. Show how payment allocation works (minimum to fees/interest, excess to highest APR balances).
6. Identify any promotional rates and expiration dates.
7. Explain statement closing date vs. payment due date (typically 21-25 day grace period).

For specific merchant questions, provide merchant contact information from statement.
